meanings.definition: An organized whole that is perceived as more than the sum of its parts.
meanings.sent1: The gestalt of the team's performance was greater than each player's individual contribution.
meanings.sent2: When looking at the painting, the gestalt of colors and shapes created a beautiful image.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces formed a gestalt that revealed a hidden message when put together.
meanings.sent4: In nature, the ecosystem functions as a gestalt where each species plays a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The music ensemble's harmony was a gestalt of different instruments blending perfectly.

meanings.definition: A configuration or pattern of elements so unified as a whole that it cannot be described merely as a sum of its parts.
meanings.sent1: The gestalt of the design made it stand out among the other buildings in the city.
meanings.sent2: The logo's gestalt captured the essence of the company's values in a simple symbol.
meanings.sent3: The recipe's gestalt of flavors surprised everyone with its unique combination.
meanings.sent4: The dance performance was a gestalt of movements that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The story's gestalt of characters and plot twists kept readers engaged till the end.
